comments.commentBody: And I will not give up my right to live for someone else's desire to own an assault rifle and then use it on people. The evil may be in a person, but they use a gun more often than anything else in this country. People kill people with guns. Period. More than any other weapon. And if you think it's just Islam that's the problem here, you don't have enough reading comprehension, because the last mass shooting before this one was conducted by a right-wing Christian, and he is a terrorist. We have more to fear from right-wing Christians than we do from anyone else living in this country.

The NRA and the jihadists are after the same thing--to put Americans in a state of permanent fear. The NRA says the solution is to arm us all to the teeth and prepared for shootouts, but the mass murderers will always be better armed, and in body armor, and the chaos will never end. This is also what the jihadists want. Nothing will change until we get weapons of war out of America permanently and thoroughly. It won't be easy but until we do the jihadists will succeed, with the aid of the NRA.

So, when my 82 year old grandmother pulled her little .25 caliber pistol from under her pillow last year and shot the intruder who broke through her bedroom window screen while she was sleeping, she was guilty of what? Perversion? White privilege? 'Detached paralysis?' Police respond after the fact, they do not prevent or intercede. Grownups take responsibility for their own lives. The average 911 police response time in the US is 9 minutes. Do you have a speech that is going to hold the bad guy off from murdering your family or that long? If so, please share it with those of us who has been the victims of violent crime. We'd love to hear it.

You americans. You always have an excuse about why someone should have the ability to shoot someone.

In all other developed nations people with mental illnesses are predominantly VICTIMs of violence - not perpetrators. In the USA - where the people need excuses that justify why they kill each other with guns so much - people seem to think that what enables these crimes is the mental health of the perpetrators.

i'll say this simply - like Im talking to 4 year olds: NO. GUNS. NO. MASS KILLINGS.
The 47% is about 52% now, George.

We absolutely cannot compare our gun violence situation with Paris. How many mass shootings have they had in Paris in the last year alone compared to the U.S.? Also, France is much much closer to the Syrian war front and the tragedy that occurred in Paris was executed by ISIS members that were brainwashed in Syria; not by everyday, seemingly normal civilians that have never left the country. Also, how does mental illness explain premeditated mass killing? Most mental health related 'melt-downs' are episodic and can't account for months/years of preparation. Do I believe that the state of mental health care is a true crisis in our country, absolutely. Do I think that we should address our current situation with just one solution (i.e. mental health) and hope for the best, absolutely not.

Let me first say that I absolutely hate guns.

BUT gun control is NOT the issue here. Paris has much stricter gun laws than the USA, but last month's events showed the world they're not a cure-all. Focusing on the weapons isn't going to fix the problem. Murder is illegal, but that didn't seem to bother these gunmen.

Making something illegal doesn't stop it from happening. Ask your local high school kid where to get drugs or read up on how well Prohibition worked.

The *real issue* is the severe lack of mental health services in the USA. Sane, healthy, well-adapted people don't go shooting up the place, bludgeoning random people on the street, or join cults. Sane people don't have the desire to kill/harm dozens of people. Most electrical engineers could easily take out a commercial airliner with items that are perfectly legal, and maybe even items they often carry with them...but we don't have an epidemic of electrical engineers attacking planes every day. Why? Because they're not mentally ill.

Until we're willing to commit serious resources towards mental health, this will continue with whatever weapons, guns or otherwise, mentally ill people will get ahold of. Fix the problem, not the intermediate tools used. As I said in the beginning, I wish guns didn't exist. BUT even with that, gun control isn't the solution to this problem.
Ammunition is only good for 2-3 years, so control of ammunition sales would have a much faster effect.

this repugnant man was a u.s. citizen. - not a member of isis or a refugee.

the problem is one of gun control. people should not be allowed to acquire military style guns and pariphinalia.

You have to begin somewhere. You have to stop the madness. Gun buyback programs are usually very successful, and changing this demented gun culture would be successful.

Enough is enough. Gun control now.

What we have that is even more important than great technology is our rights.  What you're describing would violate ever citizens rights under the 2nd and the 4th Amendments to the Constitution and it would do nothing to stop acts of terrorism, like what happened today in California.
Actually, if Obama can be indicted for anything it's his failure to protect the people of Paris which, incidentally, is outside his mandate.
Point of order:  automatic assault rifles are illegal in the US.  Semi-automatic (need to pull the trigger for each shot) are deadly enough.

That is such amazing nonsense. Your idea of a modern democracy is that people should be armed and ready to launch an armed revolt angainst the state? When and under what circumstances? When are all these armed idiots ( sorry, citizens, conservatives, fascists whatever you want to call them) going to organize together to take on... What? (The U.S. military? Good luck with that). You think that rights are better protected by having masses of guns in society? Which rights and whose? The rights of right wing, conservative whites to keep everyone else under control?

Andrews, the interpretation of the 2nd Amendment as protection of the people against the state is just another pretzel twist by the NRA to justify more guns so that their real constituency, the gun manufacturers, can sell more guns.  Please don't buy into it.

Unfortunately for your theory, what YOU think does not outweigh SCOTUS.

SCOTUS exists to interpret the law. I disagree with them many times, on many issues, but THEY ARE THE LAW. There is no higher authority.

You of course have the option to repeal the 2nd Amendment.

It must first pass Congress, then be ratified by 3/4ths of the States. Congress is Republican; most states are red states. Good luck.

The Second Amendment: "A well regulated Militia, being necessary to the security of a free State, the right of the people to keep and bear arms shall not be infringed." Large numbers of illiterate Americans claim that the Amendment says: "The right of the people to keep and bear arms shall not be infringed." It does not! If the SCOTUS says that it does, that means that the SCOTUS is incorrect because it is foolish to ignore the reason why this right exists. It exists to provide a well regulated militia to protect the State. That is what it actually says.
Mass killing is much easier to perpetrate than serial killing.

That there are a lot of people that have grown insensitive to the weight that a human life carries? Serial killers are deranged people, often with very troubling childhood histories. It seems like we're at a diluted level; some of the recent mass murderers clearly have intact mental and cognitive capabilities, but they don't value human life. Was this constructed by modern times?

Is it just me or does it seem like serial killers are a thing of the past, but mass killings have taken their place?  In today's society of needing "Likes" and notoriety the anonymity serial killers once desired is out-dated.  What does that say about our evolving society and its need for attention?

Not the availability of hardware(guns) alone but the incompetence of the software(education sans sensitization). Just like POTUS advised in Turkey that applies back home as well, review the syllabii, add ethics sans faith.  It scares tourists and residents as well at the sheer  thought of number of potential DIY lone  wolves. These to many stray incidents may attract organized predatory ideologies with their conversion sales pitch. Why in the first place hardware assault weapons and their training software video games are available next to candies.  As the society evolves in education and maturity humans are supposed to be interacting rather than shooting at each other for silly or no reason. Hope logic prevails after sustaining gun wounds. RIP.

I think you raise an important point.  I admit I am not well versed in these stats.  I can believe that gun homicide deaths are lower overall, and that the internet and news cycle distorts our view of the pervasiveness of violence.  But I'm pretty sure mass shootings are on the rise.  I will read the link you provided.  Your point is an extremely important part of the discussion I think.

They are having fear shoved down their throats by politicians who are paid by the gun lobby. So what they're trying to protect themselves against is an ambiguous, indeterminate concept. Which is just the way the gun industry likes it.
According to many in the GOP, a lot of these shootings were simply "made up" by liberals as an excuse to take guns away. I'm not kidding.

The right to bear military arms goes back to about 1100 AD with the formation of the Common Law system in England. US Law and the Constitution comes from Common Law.

What does the right to bear arms have to do with terrorism? The terrorists also used and enjoyed the right to free speech, to religion, of free association, and many other rights. Should we give up all our rights because sometimes someone does something evil?

Other countries have plenty of violent media and games. They do not have a fraction of the gun homicides and mass killings this country does.

Only sensible gun control will stop this carnage. Military weapons do not belong in the hands of anyone who can buy them. Terrorist suspects should not be able to buy guns. Huge amounts of ammunition are not bought as artwork.

Censor the NRA if you want to stop the violence.
But why must we make it so easy for them to do so?

We the people have let America decline into this state of domestic madness. What's the big deal about the threat of Islamic terrorists when we do such a great job of mass murders here on a daily basis with nothing but native homicidal maniacs--and their assault weapons, just like those in Paris?
...and a buy-back program so that we can motivate people to get rid of their currently circulating guns.

I think having laws is the correct first step in trying to fix this situation. It at least spreads the message that the vast majority of Americans do not approve of owning guns/assault rifles for the sake of self-preservation. We have laws against speeding, DWI, illegal narcotics, etc.so that they can be reinforced by law enforcement, people can go to jail for breaking these laws and be appropriately punished, and more people can be deterred from repeating such offenses. It may not always work, but at least it's a system. At least it's a start.
So Edmund, is your suggestion that we repeal all those laws since people still commit murder and steal and drive cars too quickly?
Politicians: Your thoughts and prayers are not working. Stop the platitudes. We need sensible gun laws, universal background checks and an assault rifle ban now.

Unless a given background check can include a means to determine 'intention' or 'inclination', then it is logical to conclude that the background checks will fail to deter these folks.  It is, however, interesting to note that the provisions and processes that allow one to purchase a type of restricted under the provisions of the 1934 Gun Control Act have been so successful that only one criminal incident was ever been used using a controlled 1934 type firearm.

Okay, I am not saying we have to hold Wayne LaPierre and the NRA accountable, but after all these occurring tragedies he has to bite the bullet so to speak, and at the very least meet halfway with politicians who want to modify the gun control laws for the better.  Will it stop these tragedies?   No.  But much needed background checks, etc. will lessen them.  Republicans need to stop giving in to the NRA lobby because one day it might be their son or daughter who gets shot.

Whatever you do, we perceive as aggression (and this, logically, is) .. we do not trust you for your irresponsibility.
We must be to have a heart conversation .but you are not capable of, and analyze together what was happening. But the notorious "save face," you will never allow to do it. Your policy is too cowardly.

I disagree with a few tucked in and snuggled up commenters, who with a cup of marshmallow hot chocolate in hand, warm blanket over their knees, with yule log in their fireplace crackling call to cuddle with a bear that is running rampant in the backyard, they should think about the bear plundering and destroying its neighbors in Ukraine, Moldova and Georgia since the collapse of the communist Russian Empire. Really?  Hmmmnn.  The West would really prefer to spend its money elsewhere than to have a NATO .... It is you guys who need NATO.   Putin would not be able to remain in power without it.   And, you wouldn't have a job.   ;-)

NATO needs provoke Russia so it can justify its own existence.
